Fires in Great Plains, Southeast, and Pacific Northwest Regions</title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005403.html</link> <description>The MODIS Aqua AOD image, below left, shows elevated values of AOD in the Rocky Mountain Region and light bands of increased AOD are apparent in the Plains Region, Texas and the Gulf of Mexico. The KNMI OMI NRT NO2...</description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>John Sullivan</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-11T10:28:11-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005402.html"> <title>Dry Air and Strong Winds Fuel Fires in NW; Elevated AOD in NE</title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005402.html</link> <description>Mild winter conditions have sparked an early fire season in the Pacific Northwest, with smoke from burns concentrated over Northern Idaho and Southern Oregon (HMS Fire and Smoke Product, top left). Fires such as those in and around Springdale, Washington...</description> <dc:subject>Air Quality News</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Farrah Daham</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-09T23:59:00-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005400.html"> <title>Weekend Edition: Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups in Pennsylvania</title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005400.html</link> <description>Two areas of the US had poorish air quality on Saturday: Washington state and Pennsylvania. It is not possible to see the increased pollution in Pennsylvania against the white surface from all the snow we had this week. But the...</description> <dc:subject>Ground-based PM Data</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Ray Hoff</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-07T20:55:38-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005399.html"> <title>Snow in Northeast; Moderate AQIs in Great Lakes and Northwest</title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005399.html</link> <description>The MODIS Terra image below left shows the new snow in the northeast from the storm over the past few days, as well as the front behind the snow moving offshore. The NWS surface analysis shows the front in more...</description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>dwes1</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-06T16:46:31-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005394.html"> <title>Code Orange in Northern California. Increased Sulfates in Southeast. </title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005394.html</link> <description>The MODIS Aqua AOD image, below left, shows low values of AOD across the country for today. There does appear to be scattered increases in AOD in the western coast of the country and light bands of increased AOD are...</description> <dc:subject>Air Quality News</dc:subject> <dc:creator>John Sullivan</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-03T18:43:32-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005393.html"> <title><![CDATA[Dust and Smoke in the South; NO<sub>2</sub> and Sulfates over Great Lakes Region]]></title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005393.html</link> <description>The Mid-Atlantic States, Great Lakes Region, Midwest, and parts of the West Coast in and around Northern California have been experiencing Moderate to Unhealthy AQIs (EPA AirNow Combined Loop, top left). These Unhealthy AQIs peaked near Reno, California a few...</description> <dc:subject>Air Quality News</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Farrah Daham</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-02T23:59:00-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005390.html"> <title>Weekend Edition: Moderate AQI east of the Mississippi and clouds everywhere</title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005390.html</link> <description>Pretty simple air quality situation over the US on Saturday. There is moderate AQI for particulates pretty much everywhere east of the Mississippi. However, there are also clouds pretty much everywhere east of the Mississippi. Very little information is added...</description> <dc:subject>Ground-based PM Data</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Ray Hoff</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-28T21:32:20-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005389.html"> <title>Moderate AQIs in East; Unhealthy in Central California</title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005389.html</link> <description>The EPA AQI loop below left shows Unhealthy AQI in central California, as well as areas of Moderate AQI stretching along the east coast and onto the Gulf coast. The OMI tropospheric NO2 image below right indicates that nitrates may...</description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>dwes1</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-27T23:59:59-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005387.html"> <title>Snow Covering Much of the United States; alongside elevated AQI</title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005387.html</link> <description>After what's been one of the snowiest and coldest winters in awhile, even parts of the deep-south are feeling the chill. The snowfall footprint stretches from the valleys of California to the nation's Capital, with measured snowfall also across the...</description> <dc:subject>Air Quality News</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Ruben Delgado</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-25T23:27:21-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005388.html"> <title>Code Red in California. Increased AOD in Southeast.</title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005388.html</link> <description>The VIIRS AOD image, below left, shows low values of AOD across the country for today. There does appear to be scattered increases in AOD near the Pacific coast of southern California. There is also an increase in AOD near...</description> <dc:subject>Air Quality News</dc:subject> <dc:creator>John Sullivan</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-24T20:26:35-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005391.html"> <title><![CDATA[Sulfates and NO<sub>2</sub> in East, Dust and Smoke in West]]></title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005391.html</link> <description>Air quality is pretty clear today except for some areas of Moderate to USG, growing and dispersing in the course of hours with most of the Moderate AQI's residing on the East coast (EPA AirNow, top left). Large concentrations of...</description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>Farrah Daham</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-23T23:59:00-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005386.html"> <title>Fires in Southeast; Air Action Day in Southern California</title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005386.html</link> <description>A few fires in the southeast continue, as seen on the MODIS Aqua image and the HMS fire and smoke product shown below (top left and top right, respectively). Fortunately, they seem to be having a limited effect on air...</description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>dwes1</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-20T23:59:59-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005385.html"> <title>Special Feature: Carbon Emissions Could Dramatically Increase Risk of U.S. Megadroughts</title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005385.html</link> <description> Droughts in the U.S. Southwest and Central Plains during the second half of the 21st century could be drier and longer than any droughts seen in those regions over the past 1,000 years. In a new study published in...</description> <dc:subject>Special Feature</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Daniel Orozco</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-19T23:38:21-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005384.html"> <title>Another Blast of Arctic Cold in the East Coast; Moderate PM2.5 in the East and West Coast</title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005384.html</link> <description>Yesterday's winter storm that brought heavy snow, sleet and freezing rain to much of the south-central U.S. has moved off the east coast. Another surge of even colder arctic air arrived tonight at the east coast and will persist into...</description> <dc:subject>Air Quality News</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Ruben Delgado</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-18T23:03:19-05:00</dc:date> </item>  <item rdf:about="http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005383.html"> <title>Good to Moderate AQIs over US, New Prescribed Fires in Midwest </title> <link>http://alg.umbc.edu/usaq/archives/005383.html</link> <description>Snow and rain storms in the Northeast and Southeast respectively brought in a couple inches of precipitation, controlling agricultural fires prescribed last week in the Southeast and helping air quality remain Good to Moderate for most of the day (EPA...</description> <dc:subject>Air Quality News</dc:subject> <dc:creator>Farrah Daham</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-02-16T23:59:00-05:00</dc:date> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
